recordings.rmk:
The bird was flying fast across a large cutting area in the forest, 50-100 m up in the air, all the time sounding like this. Clear and sunny weather, no wind.
The recording has been high pass filtered and some clicks muted.

Prior to recording flight display ("butterfly") over mixed forest. Recording: calls when flying towards another (Honey?) Buzzard. After recording: 9 (Honey?) Buzzards soaring for several minutes, then one of them (the displaying bird?) heads back to where he started out. Not exact location due to conservation.

Audio track extracted from a nest camera video clip, not edited.

recordings.rmk: Calling while flying in circles above the woods.

Several of these birds are nesting / ranging in the forest next to our house. I often see buzzards (slightly different call) circling over the fields nearby. Could this just be adult - juvenile calls near the nest from the buzzards? Or is it another species?? Many thanks,

Damiano
Series of calls heard on 2 occasions in a big forest

Flight call.
Two birds together in flight near the nesting site.
One bird was propably a juvenile.
